Legal_Issue: Whether the Citizenship Judge erred in finding the Applicant did not meet the residency requirement under paragraph 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act
Application_Facts: Applicant was physically present in Canada for 571 days out of the required 1,095 days within four years before applying
Court_Ruling: The Citizenship Judge's decision was reasonable; no legal or factual errors were found
Defendant_Behavior: Extended absences from Canada during the relevant period
Grounds_for_Claim: Insufficient physical presence and failure to meet centralized mode of living test
Legal_Standard: Three years of residence in Canada within four years before application
Assessment_Factor: Family ties, property ownership, duration and frequency of absences
Procedural_Issue: Appeal filed under the Federal Courts Act and Citizenship Act
Review_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to the Citizenship Judge's decision
Evidence_Used: Records of physical presence, evidence of family and property ties in Canada
Application_Basis: Residency calculation and Re Koo centralized mode of living test
Evidence_Assessed: Duration of stay, nature of absences, connections to Canada
Relief_Sought: Overturning the refusal of citizenship application
Governing_Rule: Re Koo test for determining residency when physical presence is insufficient
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Insufficient proof of residency through physical presence or centralized living in Canada
Cause_Description: Applicant's application for Canadian citizenship was denied due to insufficient residency days
Evidence_Handling: Residency records and personal ties evaluated under Re Koo framework
Evidence_Issues: Lack of sufficient documentation or demonstration of residency despite some physical presence
Evidence_Assessment: Factors from Re Koo test applied to assess de facto residency
Decision_Rationale: The Applicantâ€™s absences were too extensive and did not satisfy either physical presence or centralized living requirements
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to demonstrate that absences were temporary or that primary mode of living remained in Canada
Legal_Standard_Applied: Centralized mode of living test (Re Koo)
